title: CourseInstance
description: An instance of a [[Course]] which is distinct from other instances because it is offered at a different time or location or through different media or modes of study or to a specific section of students.

courseMode.description: The medium or means of delivery of the course instance or the mode of study, either as a text label (e.g. "online", "onsite" or "blended"; "synchronous" or "asynchronous"; "full-time" or "part-time") or as a URL reference to a term from a controlled vocabulary (e.g. https://ceds.ed.gov/element/001311#Asynchronous).

instructor.description: A person assigned to instruct or provide instructional assistance for the [[CourseInstance]].

courseSchedule.description: Represents the length and pace of a course, expressed as a [[Schedule]].

courseWorkload.description: The amount of work expected of students taking the course, often provided as a figure per week or per month, and may be broken down by type. For example, "2 hours of lectures, 1 hour of lab work and 3 hours of independent study per week".
